title: Grade 4
subject: Extended Content Standards For English Language Arts (2017-)

document.title: North Carolina EXTENDED CONTENT STANDARDS English Language Arts K-12

9BD656C8318D435F8A0FB2C6144858A5.description: Use words acquired through conversations, being read to, and during shared reading activities including domain-specific words.

A385A0AA83E64F3380841969420EBB5B.description:
CCR Anchor Standard L.6 – Acquire and use accurately a range of general academic and domain-specific words and phrases sufficient for
reading, writing, speaking, and listening at the college and career readiness level; demonstrate independence in developing vocabulary
knowledge when encountering an unknown term important to comprehension or expression.

7FA3E23891114203BE7F7B839E68F7D3.description: Use common idioms (e.g., no way, not a chance, you bet).

8D341DCCB5D84F1DB464D95AB8D40DF2.description: Demonstrate understanding of word relationships and use.

AEA566C4A2D340249F61E3765E841EC9.description: CCR Anchor Standard L.5 – Demonstrate understanding of figurative language and nuances in word meanings.

0CAF1931ACE04FD69FD91A4629248430.description: Demonstrate knowledge of word meanings drawn from grade 4 content.

AA4EBFB2255342B686144DC287FE9033.description:
CCR Anchor Standard L.4 – Determine and clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases by using context
clues, analyzing meaningful word parts, and consulting general and specialized reference materials, as appropriate.

963E449CABF74D1CAA21A9D45C32FA50.description: Communicate effectively with peers and adults.

6FE6FC5D25F848629112460AD57B3C78.description: Use language to achieve desired outcomes when communicating.

537FE4A904994AC5B8B4D3E914D383B0.description:
CCR Anchor Standard L.3 – Apply knowledge of language to understand how language functions in different contexts, to make effective
choices for meaning or style, and to comprehend more fully reading or listening.

FFA9EF6E22384885BEF0C52537B7CF58.description: Demonstrate understanding of conventions of standard English within 4-5 conventions continuum when writing.

34587F59CBD7476F8C461647C6D0A5D1.description:
CCR Anchor Standard L.2 – Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling when
writing; demonstrate proficiency within the appropriate grade band conventions continuum.

4086312284EE438F8F5EC79BC87620C5.description: Demonstrate standard English grammar and usage within the 4-5 grammar continuum when writing or communicating.

4396BC54B1D44432BCEFA9E8CD84E61B.description:
CCR Anchor Standard L.1 – Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English grammar and usage when writing or speaking;
demonstrate proficiency within the appropriate grade band grammar continuum.

E5F7A04280AA4F6591E5B65D3C1D27CE.description:
CCR Anchor Standard SL.6 – Determine whether information presented in diverse media (book, newspaper, video, television, internet) is
credible and identify discrepancies.

89EBDDEFC2E943248A6E7A3ACC3484B9.description: Add audio recordings or visuals to a presentation about a personally relevant topic.

C19A683D2F6B420D8A3427A0378E94BE.description:
CCR Anchor Standard SL.5 – Make strategic use of digital media and visual displays of data to express information and enhance
understanding of presentations.

1FBA0EBC28B24179802802EB3ACCAAEC.description: Communicate opinion on a familiar topic or text in an organized manner.

7DC3C1718E9C4D92A23AC26AF30B1C49.description:
CCR Anchor Standard SL.4 – Present information, findings, and supporting evidence such that listeners can follow the line of reasoning
and the organization, development, and style are appropriate to task, purpose, and audience.

E8FD3B5B70664FBB805BCCCF2D2729B6.description: Identify a point that the speaker makes.

5AD8264BA76B41F2BB7336B729582C65.description:
CCR Anchor Standard SL.3 – Determine whether information presented in diverse media (book, newspaper, video, television, internet) is
credible and identify discrepancies.

E802153053DC4FA2875888B59D8B89A7.description: Ask and answer questions about details from a text read aloud or information presented orally or through other media.

277EAD8E1E2D4CD7859914D36E2A6C8F.description:
CCR Anchor Standard SL.2 – Integrate and evaluate information presented in diverse media and formats, including visually, quantitatively,
and orally.

A67236074EE149D9B5CDC4C2C30E2EBB.description: Identify the key ideas in a discussion.

52A3CCEC70E84653AA71DF1A31D5B917.description: Answer specific questions related to information in a discussion.

168DFCB0E7EA4791954A23CDCDB484BE.description: With guidance and support, carry out assigned role in a discussion.

18FE01292C394FA1B75FF07D3A181080.description: Contribute ideas from prior knowledge of a text during discussions about the same text.

0F91663EF23A40D2A0B5873D361B0F2B.description: Communicate with others in group interactions.

56C28E806F7840249DE3F5D3159B2818.description:
CCR Anchor Standard SL.1 – Prepare for and participate effectively in a range of conversations and collaborations with diverse partners,
building on others’ ideas and expressing their own clearly and persuasively.

F7A7E554944E45788BA308EAF80A7729.description: Integrated into Standards W.1, W.2, and W.3

6C2A0B9A8955473388C6619E35CD2D67.description:
CCR Anchor Standard W.10 (in 2010 Standards) – 2010: Write routinely over extended time frames (time for research, reflection, and
revision) and shorter time frames (a single sitting or a day or two) for a range of tasks, purposes, and audiences.

140E7EE2D0164C28BE28AED3A612E862.description: Omitted because it is an expectation of RL and RI Standards

082ECCE2163840A996E3295AD72F507A.description:
CCR Anchor Standard W.9 (in 2010 Standards) – 2010: Draw evidence from literary or informational texts to support analysis, reflection,
and research. Proposed: Omitted because it is an expectation of RL and RI Standards

2BCC5DEA030C4E08975719C7D2A977AC.description: Gather and sort information from personal experiences or a topic into given categories.

F93D96CAC9304EFCAF2EA504E476470C.description:
CCR Anchor Standard W.6 (from Proposed Standards – was W.8 in 2010 Standards) – Gather relevant information from multiple print and
digital sources, assess the credibility and accuracy of each source, and integrate the information while avoiding plagiarism.

956580D178A84459BCD7D432DE3B5A19.description: Gather information about a topic from two or more sources for a research project.

C17EF9FAE2A44235A3B60A5A61C8890C.description:
CCR Anchor Standard W.5 (from Proposed Standards – was W.7 in 2010 Standards) – Conduct short as well as more sustained research
projects based on focused questions, demonstrating understanding of the subject under investigation.

A1681F0A12D142A48A0C82763B9B559F.description: With guidance and support from adults, use digital tools to produce writing while interacting and collaborating with others.

680C5A9A884548DB839791BB01218FAB.description: CR Anchor Standard W.4: Use digital tools and resources to produce and publish writing and to interact and collaborate with others.

388061684E984CAEA2B23369D03AEB4D.description: List words that describe an event or personal experience to use when writing about it.

05116A4A18724981BB8B2622D92C4852.description: Write about a personal experience including two events in sequence.

61366D9D57244790A72138E35AABBFDF.description: Write about events or personal experiences.

8BAE350A000B4E179896B05B40C1A0B0.description:
CCR Anchor Standard W.3 – Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, well-chosen
details, and well-structured event sequences.

8E867A6055514F72BBCA932E12E9D5A7.description: List words, facts, or details related to the topic.

4F150CD83D8F4CB2BCE87887DB542766.description: Select a topic and write about it including related visual, tactual, or multimedia information as appropriate.

177F6D40E92342CD8718559994F8471D.description: Write to share information supported by details.

07B20117C96745798CEB0D34671461C6.description:
CCR Anchor Standard W.2 – Write informative/explanatory texts to examine and convey complex ideas and information clearly and
accurately through the effective selection, organization, and analysis of content.

3155CEABE1F0401BB331711E38987A40.description: List reasons to support the opinion.

844C216FE4A64CC18A6F10C1438C3143.description: Select a topic or text and write an opinion about it.

FD514E1A6EAD4C1086DE583C94E121FB.description: Write an opinion about topics or texts, supporting a point of view with reasons.

0C422414DB494B1A8A89F1BD4A5451CE.description:
CCR Anchor Standard W.1 – Write arguments to support claims in an analysis of substantive topics or texts, using valid reasoning and
relevant and sufficient evidence.

B3DE2F0038C0433BBDD40F70102344AE.description: Use letter knowledge and context to support word recognition when reading.

AE20AF8364274C158B2B1755A000045F.description: Read text comprised of familiar words with accuracy and understanding.

B9C951FD424F42E2B00CEBA63001CD58.description: Engage in purposeful reading of text.

84A26941E1434D5AA91B1D96F141D1CA.description: Decode single-syllable words with common spelling patterns (consonant-vowel- consonant [CVC] or high-frequency rimes).

92F987D3B67344AF8AA36000580D1A3A.description: Apply letter-sound knowledge to use first letter plus context to identify unfamiliar words.

174139FB0B4F4957A95598A85B55F670.description: Apply letter-sound knowledge to decode words."

19A30F5DE1DE475BAF7901E96961B1A5.description: Uses letters to create written documents.

5AD8AFD8950540D0B026766E5B2B4DDE.description:
Actively engage in reading of information text for sustained periods of time for the purpose of connecting prior knowledge and experiences to
text.

5AB473BCE36A40E9BEEB6E718E373FB5.description:
CR Anchor Standard RI.10: Read and comprehend complex literary and informational texts independently and proficiently, connecting prior
knowledge and experiences to text.

825156744B144261A375997FF371733B.description: Compare details presented in two texts on the same topic.

4BC90715B30F45319A7A6F6694EA81A4.description:
CCR Anchor Standard RI.9 – Analyze how two or more texts address similar themes or topics in order to build knowledge or to compare
the approaches the authors take.

00D6C045975644BF803BC0F23C326B3D.description: Identify one or more details supporting a specific point in an informational text.

E19ED0A607CA40AEBAA0E0161DE7EB42.description:
CCR Anchor Standard RI.8 – Delineate and evaluate the argument and specific claims in a text, including the validity of the reasoning as
well as the relevance and sufficiency of the evidence.

B1395FD1033843E2ADEAB7C0A724B348.description: Answer questions about information presented visually, orally, or quantitatively.

12918074693543ACAE5D36E3A98CF058.description:
CCR Anchor Standard RI.7 – Integrate and evaluate content presented in diverse media and formats, including visually and quantitatively,
as well as in words.

896E14D15B3A424FAB147132BC987237.description: Compare own experience with a written account of the same experience.

797F2FF190A744A38C23D75F32DCDAB9.description: CCR Anchor Standard RI.6: Assess how point of view, perspective, or purpose shapes the content and style of a text.

97BF99B46A694BC4B1A65CA6282D351C.description: During reading, identify elements such as events, ideas, or topics that are characteristic of informational text

FD4DECF10E8C4679A98373404C260AC0.description:
CCR Anchor Standard RI.5 – Analyze the structure of texts, including how specific sentences, paragraphs, and larger portions of the text
(e.g., a section, chapter, scene, or stanza) relate to each other and the whole.

3E21F0194C774447B78A4B340A1712C6.description: Determine meaning of words in text.

61A53C0F04BE4D1CA2581890626E1365.description:
CCR Anchor Standard RI.4: Interpret words and phrases as they are used in a text and analyze how specific word choices shape meaning
or tone.

8E1DDF5B6A5B4E7683DFE6DACB00D679.description: Identify an explicit detail that is related to an individual, event, or idea in a historical, scientific, or technical text.

3A0C09DD4075480D8F8732F022082334.description: CCR Anchor Standard RI.3 – Analyze how and why individuals, events, and ideas develop and interact over the course of a text.

BD8ACA1DC13543AEB7103ECC7D4C55FA.description: Identify the main idea of a text when it is explicitly stated.

9562256E7E4449DDB11E32725C2DD808.description:
CCR Anchor Standard RI.2 – Determine central ideas or themes of a text and analyze their development; summarize the key supporting
details and ideas.

F9908BB71E5F4B559CB0DEF944DCD59C.description: Identify explicit details in an informational text.

462E63E135584495BEE3FBCB74A7E39A.description:
CCR Anchor Standard RI.1 – Read closely to determine what the text says explicitly and to make logical inferences from it; cite specific
textual evidence when writing or speaking to support conclusions drawn from the text.

00DF6B1498CA40A592047D4035D7088E.description: Actively engage in reading for the purpose of connecting prior knowledge and experiences to text for sustained periods of time.

7516BA63A06E4B67B2656DCA633938EA.description:
CCR Anchor Standard RL.10: Read and comprehend complex literary and informational texts independently and proficiently, connecting
prior knowledge and experiences to text.

70425794934046B3909B34B1C0A1B3D4.description: Compare characters, settings, or events in stories, myths, or texts from different cultures.

5C61A798B0964D40966E32AD384B2768.description:
CCRAnchorStandardRL.9 – Analyze how two or more texts address similar themes or topics in order to build knowledge or to compare the
approaches the authors take.

508314C9E162402E860BF09436063F69.description:
CCR Anchor Standard RL.8 – Delineate and evaluate the argument and specific claims in a text, including the validity of the reasoning as
well as the relevance and sufficiency of the evidence.

F565C4626AF7488A97B0955AD132454E.description: Compare the text representation of a story to a visual, tactual, or oral version of the same story.

5ACD5D8EDD744A298D49ED9801F7684D.description:
CCR Anchor Standard RL.7 – Integrate and evaluate content presented in diverse media and formats, including visually and quantitatively,
as well as in words.

C3D8A435128B4E6788D9E9396DADBD8E.description: Identify the narrator of a story with first person narration.

5464D076E63C43799C8BEC15A394130C.description: CCR Anchor Standard RL.6 Assess how point of view, perspective, or purpose shapes the content and style of a text.

AAD2932B0E0A458CA51F77073C2432AB.description: Identify elements that are characteristics of stories.

CD7392B6757348ACACB7BE2DE92F9142.description:
CCR Anchor Standard RL.5 – Analyze the structure of texts, including how specific sentences, paragraphs, and larger portions of the text
(e.g., a section, chapter, scene, or stanza) relate to each other and the whole.

BEAF139A266549E2908BBC38688C0A6E.description: Determine the meaning of words in a text.

AA06B565C4F446D8A5D559F4A1AB5E70.description: RL.4: Interpret words and phrases as they are used in a text and analyze how specific word choices shape meaning or tone.

775AD5E05745411B8FE1C3BE61604D3B.description: Use details from the text to describe characters in the story.

61E73F5FA51147DA892212CABF6435B0.description: CCR Anchor Standard RL.3 –Analyze how and why individuals, events, and ideas develop and interact over the course of a text.

A822CB6DF67C49A19C97D71FCDF57C6A.description: Identify the theme of a familiar story, drama or poem.

D9F4F1FB1CFF4775857A992E598C3235.description:
CCR Anchor Standard RL.2 –Determine central ideas or themes of a text and analyze their development; summarize the key supporting
details and ideas.

17FC6494238043CB8509604D392E5B41.description: Use details from the text to recount what the text says.

0FD3B110BC7742269FF63A4F757D4A5B.description:
CCR Anchor Standard RL.1 – Read closely to determine what the text says explicitly and to make logical inferences from it; cite specific
textual evidence when writing or speaking to support conclusions drawn from the text.
